lead_paragraph: ﻿﻿Maciek Nabrdalik set out to photograph Holocaust survivors with a case full of studio equipment. At times, his subjects waited for him dressed in their best attire. He quickly realized that such formality would detract from his goal: to capture memories of the Holocaust through his subjects' facial expressions.
snippet: His subjects' back stories were complicated enough, so Maciek Nabrdalik minimized the setting to focus on their faces, Eirini Vourloumis reports.

headline.main: One Last Sitting for Holocaust Survivors

abstract: His subjects' back stories were complicated enough, so Maciek Nabrdalik minimized the setting to focus on their faces, Eirini Vourloumis reports.
